page.title: 13TRADE IN BAGILT
page.content: Since the opening of the dual carriageway in 1968 trade in Bagillt has diminished quite considerably. Prior to the dual carriageway opening, the main coast traffic from Flint- Mostyn had to go through the centre of the village.The dual carriageway cut out approximately 80% of the village.A considerable number of shops have closed.Only some of the local people use the village shops.Most of the population buy the bulk of their shopping in Flint or Holywell-in the larger supermarkets.Shopping at Holywell street market on Thursday and Flint street market on Friday is popular.The Coed Mawr Sunday market between Greenfield/Mostyn is popular. Fruit,vegetables,clothes,tools, household items are sold.Many local people walk to the Sunday market.
